data.title: It's worth the price
data.text:
I used to frequent Enliten when I worked off Center Street in Provo. The sandwiches were always my go-to, specifically the club, and they were always delicious. The chicken is actual rotisserie chicken, the bacon is thick, and the bread is always delicious. Many of their ingredients are locally grown, and organic, which makes the slightly high prices very reasonable ($8-$9ish for a sandwich alone, no sides included).
The employees have always been friendly and the ambiance is local and comfy. The mural on the wall is gorgeous. It does seem a bit awkward that it is openly connected to the restaurant next door, which seems to bring in a lot more noise.
My only two issues with Enliten is the abnormally long wait for a sandwich to be made, and the change in breads. I have ordered the same sandwich multiple times, and it is almost always on different bread than the time before. That being said, the bread has always been great, so it's a minor complaint.
Overall, it's a great local business with quality ingredients that's perfectly located in the little downtown of Provo.

data.title: "Nice Little Bakery and Coffee Place"
data.text: I stumbled upon Enliten Bakery snd Cafe while walked around downtown Provo. The coffee and cinnamon rolls were very good. I sat outside which is a great spot to people watch.

data.title: A tasty little stop
data.text: Not my favorite cafe in the area but the bakery items were quite tasty. I love the passion bar. Emphasis on the bakery items here though the bar items are good. I just prefer a little more cozy and hometown coffee shop experience.

data.title: Yummy desserts
data.text: We bought a brownie, chocolate bombe and an eclair. After the first bite, no one wanted to share. But we did. Everything tasted so good. And fresh. Would definitely visit again.

data.title: Great Experience
data.text: I went to the café on their poetry night. I had a nice Chai tea and cinnamon roll. The cinnamon roll was nice warm and slightly crispy which I really enjoyed. The Chai tea was strongly infused and was a nice contrast to the cinnamon roll. Poetry night is open to everyone and free. It starts at 7:30p and ends around 9:00p.

data.title: Fun, quick or lengthy stop
data.text: This little cafe offers everything from bakery items to great sandwiches, soups, and gourmet drinks.  With a walk-through entrance to Guru's next door, it is a great place to take a group with a variety of tastes.  There is plenty of open, well-lit space to sit and relax, or it is very easy to run in for a grab-n-go.  Either way, their food is yummy.

data.title: Best Brownies in Town
data.text: Its technically part of Gurus.  Great soups and sandwiches but really the reason you want to go here is for their fresh baked goods. Try the brownies you will not be disappointed.  They only bake one tray a day so you better be fast.

data.title: great desserts!
data.text:
Besides dessert, this little bakery offers soup, salad and sandwiches. We will probably go back so we can try their other offerings. The day we were there we had already eaten lunch so we were just there for dessert. 

You have to stop by and try one of their desserts. They are incredible! We had a chocolate and macaroon cookie - it was only 99 cents. Some of their desserts are more pricey. But we just wanted a little treat and it was perfect.

data.title: good lunch
data.text: nice service salad and sandwhich were pretty good.  i had the rueban or pastrami while my friend had a salad of some sort, both were fresh and filling.  this will hit the spot and they have a large variety to choose from.

data.title: Rica pastelería
data.text: Esta panadería y cafe en Provo que se llama Enliten Bakery And Cafe es el lugar ideal para comer rica pastelería y buen café.
